DOC.brief_title: HIV Prevention Among Latino MSM : Evaluation Locally Developed Intervention
DOC.detailed_description: Wake Forest University partner Chatham Social Health Council conduct randomize controlled trial evaluate efficacy Hombres Ofreciendo Liderazgo Apoyo ( HOLA ) en Grupos ( Men Giving Leadership Support Groups ) HIV risk behavior intervention Latino men sex men ( MSM ) , age 18 , rural North Carolina . The Spanish language HOLA en Grupos develop Chatham Social Health Council close collaboration partnership local Latino community , include Latino MSM , representative local community-based participatory research ( CBPR ) partnership existence nearly ten year , deliver Council Latino MSM area include 6 largely rural county two year . HOLA en Grupos consist four 4-hour group session combine presentation facilitator train Latino MSM community member , activity , scene DVD , delivered period two week group 10 participant . HOLA en Grupos design increase HIV prevention knowledge , condom use mastery , decrease barrier risk reduction ( e.g. , health-compromising aspect machismo ) , enhance sexual negotiation skill , increase use HIV testing , counseling , treatment service among intervention participant . The Spanish language comparison condition consist four 4-hour group session design increase participant ' knowledge cancer , diabetes , alcohol abuse , cardiovascular disease , delivered period two week group 10 participant . The content focus comparison condition reflect desire community partner provide type information community member . A total 300 Latino MSM ( 150 per condition ) screen eligible , recruit wave 20 men ( 10 per condition ) . Eligible individual must self-identify Latino Hispanic , ≥ 18 year age , report MSM behavior since age ≥ 18 , provide inform consent . Individuals participate HOLA en Grupos , intervention Latino heterosexual men ( HoMBReS HoMBReS-2 ) , exclude study . Study assessment conduct baseline 6-month follow-up .
